div.head: To the Right Worshipfull Syr Iohn Hart Knight, all health and Happines.
div.p: HEathen people (Right Worshipfull) lead by Nature, abhorred nothing more than a man Ingratefull: The Christians taught from Heauen, command nothing oftner than to be thankefull. To auoid the reproofe of the one, and obey the charge of the other, I present your Worship (in signe of my sincere affect) with this small conceit, pend by a Gentleman my deare friend. The matter may at the first sight (I graunt) seeme nothing graue, but in the proceeding it will prooue Gratious: Diogenes reprooues the vitious, commendes the vertuous, vnmasks sinne, and sets downe remedies. If you accept it and forget my boldnes, my desire is satisfied, and the Author no lesse pleased.
